intro: Cnemidia nervosa, commonly known as the slender nerve-leaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves with prominent venation. It produces small white or pink flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Cnemidia nervosa is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands.
